explains: v. 把……定名为，把……描述为；任命，指定；标明，标示
adj. 已当选而尚未上任的

sentences.en: Japan's prime minister-designate is completing his cabinet today.
sentences.cn: 日本即将上任的首相今天将完成他的内阁组建。

sentences.en: There are efforts under way to designate the bridge a historic landmark.
sentences.cn: 在努力把这座桥定为历史地标。

sentences.en: They had pushed the agency to designate the bird as "endangered," a status that gives federal officials greater regulatory power to crack down on threats.
sentences.cn: 他们敦促该机构将这种鸟列为“濒危”，这个地位可以赋予联邦官员更大的监管权力来打击对鸟的威胁。
